original:
The introduction of Islam in the Harari region can be traced back to the efforts of Muslim religious figures in the 7th century in the northeast of present-day Ethiopia, followed by the coastal areas of neighboring Somalia in the 8th century. This early spread of the religion was influenced by the cultural interactions between indigenous nomadic groups and trade partners from beyond the region.


The confluence of these diverse cultural
